meanings.definition: The act of accustoming or the state of being accustomed.
meanings.sent1: Her accustomations to the new school took some time, but she eventually felt comfortable.
meanings.sent2: The accustomations to the cold weather were challenging for the tropical bird.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's accustomations to wearing a tuxedo every day made the other animals chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His accustomations to early mornings were like a well-worn path through the forest of his daily routine.
meanings.sent5: The accustomations of the old house to creaking and groaning in the night added to its spooky charm.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming accustomed to something.
meanings.sent1: The accustomations to the new technology were slow but steady.
meanings.sent2: Her accustomations to the spicy food of the region were evident in her choice of dishes.
meanings.sent3: The robot's accustomations to human emotions led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: His accustomations to the fast-paced city life were like learning to dance to a new rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The accustomations of the plant to its new environment were visible in its growth patterns.

meanings.definition: The habitual practice or custom of a particular group or society.
meanings.sent1: The accustomations of the tribe included a special dance performed during harvest.
meanings.sent2: His accustomations to the local traditions made him feel like a part of the community.
meanings.sent3: The cat's accustomations to demanding treats at midnight amused its owner.
meanings.sent4: The accustomations of the team to working together seamlessly were key to their success.
meanings.sent5: The accustomations of the town to celebrating the annual festival brought joy to all its residents.
